journal.title: Bulletin of the Belarussian State Agricultural Academy : the guidance journal

person.name: Shalkevich, M.S., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Potato, Vegetable and Fruit Growing (Belarus). Institute for Fruit Growing

abstract.value: The article presents results of research in the conditions of Belarus into 14 variety samples of Lonicera caeruleae L. of different geographic and genetic origin according to their productivity. The best combination of productivity components (total length of growth increase, the number of double-flowers per one running metre, average weight of fruit) was in the variety Sirius, which determined its maximal potential productivity – 7.2 t/ha. Varieties Ognenny opal, Selena, Volkhova and hybrid № 3 had not much lower potential productivity. The degree of realization of productivity potential varied from 48 to 85 %, and this indicator was maximal in the variety Lux. High degree of potential productivity was in the varieties Volkhova, Ognenny opal, Slavyanka, Sodruzhestvo, Solovey, Suvenir and hybrid № 2.
